Generate UUIDs

Source: R/uuid.R
uuid.Rd

Generate UUIDs using the uuid package. This is simply a thin wrapper around uuid::UUIDgenerate that matches the interface in the rest of the ids package.

uuid(n = 1, drop_hyphens = FALSE, use_time = NA)

Arguments

n

number of ids to return. If NULL, it instead returns the generating function
drop_hyphens

Drop the hyphens from the UUID?
use_time

Passed through to UUIDgenerate as use.time.

Author

Rich FitzJohn

Examples

# Generate one id
uuid()

#> [1] "336dff63-5ecb-4d85-8424-1d11bc084c06"

# Or a bunch
uuid(10)

#>  [1] "d4766905-c563-454c-8b93-cc8b6472c00d"
#>  [2] "3a76ea86-44a2-4a3e-a065-122fcf212e0f"
#>  [3] "7944381d-8757-41bd-b13e-140efdfba9ef"
#>  [4] "57919ce9-4f7f-4931-981f-44db25d08a34"
#>  [5] "17b729a2-7b4d-499f-9e9b-f3e3d3ea388a"
#>  [6] "aec0f2b4-ffa1-4894-adbd-ee6b8e716fab"
#>  [7] "269a1201-7a19-48f6-8fa8-2035143ddc1e"
#>  [8] "13fe4feb-345b-483e-ad47-a444efd9f07d"
#>  [9] "b3d11288-1402-4f1d-b531-5c3d57db2cc8"
#> [10] "b165b905-e47e-44fe-b865-68bcf215ed47"

# More in the style of random_id()
uuid(drop_hyphens = TRUE)

#> [1] "2a2a54245d8747aeb1a9e422b00a43d0"
